page.title: 01THE WOODFORD VALLEY,WILTS
page.content: This is an area stretching from the 'Christchurch' Avon in the West to High Post Golf Course in the East, north of Salisbury and south of Amesbury. The soil is chalk and flint and it is an area of arable and sheep farming much visited by tourists as they travel betwen Salisbury, with its cathedral and the ancient 'rotten borough' of Old Sarum, to Stonehenge and Avebury. There is also a strong military connection with the Army at Bulford, Tidworth and Wilton, and the R.A.F. at Boscombe Down Experimental Air Station, often using the the area for training and relaxation. The river is extensively fished for trout.
